div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 2084 Selinunte, 1923 (953) Burial: c. 455 B.C. (Herzfelder); c. 435 (Jenkins) Contents: 475 AR Acragas: 3 tetradr.; 88 didr. Catana: 2 tetradr. Gela: 25 tetradr. (to Jenkins 378) 70 didr. ANS 1957.172.560 ANS 1957.172.555 Himera: 1 tetradr.; 1 didr.; 2 dr. (archaic) Leontini: 19 tetradr. (incl. Apollo hds.) 8 didr. ANS 1957.172.575 ANS 1925.172.24 Messana: 20 tetradr. Selinus: 25 tetradr. (to Schwabacher 11) 75 didr. (Heracles/Hypsas) ANS 1957.172.628 ANS 1957.172.630 ANS 1957.172.629 ANS 1957.172.624 ANS 1957.172.625 ANS 1925.172.30 ANS 1925.172.29 ANS 1957.172.626 ANS 1957.172.627 Syracuse: 132 tetradr. (to Boehringer 604) 4 didr. ANS 1957.172.1850 ANS 1925.172.58 ANS 1957.172.1818 ANS 1957.172.1831 Disposition: Hoyt Miller 36 (presumably most are now New York but only 7 can be firmly identified: 3 Gela, 1 Himera, 1 Leontini, 2 Syracuse); A. H. Lloyd 117 (incl. SNG 800-1, 808, 891, 952, 959, 961-2, 966, 969, 1019, 1052-6, 1059, 1220, 1225, 1230, 1241-66, 1308, 1316, 1318, 1320, 1322-3, 1328-30, 1333-8, 1341). Twelve coins of Selinus given to BM by Lloyd in 1924 (Ill. Lond. News 1924, p. 1246), obviously from this hd., are presumably included in the 117 acquired by him â€ Lloyd, NC 1925, pp. 277-300, illus. Herzfelder, Rhegion, pp. 47-9 Jenkins, Gela, pp. 66, 159
